title: Register as a childminder (England)

ordered_steps.title: Check if you are eligible
ordered_steps.description: You will need to fit certain criterea to get on the early years register.

ordered_tasks.title: Check if someone can work in the UK
Become a registered early years or childcare provider in England
Applying to waive disqualification: early years and childcare providers

ordered_steps.title: Contact your local council
ordered_steps.description: You must contact your local council before you can start applying to be a childminder. Your local council will often be your main point of contact when becoming a childminder.

ordered_steps.title: Get a criminal history check
ordered_steps.description: Before you apply you must get a criminal record check for yourself and anyone else who will be on the premesis where you are looking after children. This is to ensure the safety of children in your care. This criminal check is called a DBS check, previously known as a CRB check.

ordered_tasks.title: Get a DBS check through Ofsted
Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) checks: childcare providers

ordered_steps.title: Get a health check
ordered_steps.description: You must complete a health declaration and take it to your GP. This will include information about any health condition that may affect your ability to safely care for children.

ordered_tasks.title: Become a childcare or children's social care provider: health declaration

ordered_steps.title: Do childminder training
ordered_steps.description: You must do training to look after children. You can get information about this through your local council.

ordered_steps.title: Learn about the Early Years Foundation Stage
ordered_steps.description: Childcare providers in England must follow the statutory guidance laid out in the Early Years Foundation Stage Framework. You should familiarise yourself with this before applying.

ordered_steps.title: Do first aid training
ordered_steps.description: You need to do a 12-hour first aid training course with an accredited training provider if you are looking after children 5 years old and younger.

ordered_steps.title: Apply to Ofsted
ordered_steps.description: You must apply online with Ofsted. You will need two people to write references recommending you, your DBS checks and training certificates.

ordered_tasks.title: Pay your registration and annual fee to Ofsted

description: You must register with Ofsted or a childminder agency.

details.body:
You must register with Ofsted or a childminder agency if you want to be paid to look after children under 8 for more than 2 hours a day in England.

The process to register can take from 4 to 12 weeks.
